Grain.Do: Whole grains like quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), brown rice (1/2 cup cooked), oats (1/2 cup cooked). Opt for cooling grains.
Grain.Dont: Refined grains like white rice, white bread, pastries, and overly spicy grains.

Legume.Do: Mung beans (1/2 cup cooked), split peas (1/2 cup cooked), lentils (1/2 cup cooked). Favor lighter, easier-to-digest legumes.
Legume.Dont: Heavy legumes like black beans, kidney beans, and chickpeas if they cause acidity.

Veg.Do: Cooling and slightly bitter vegetables: cucumber (1 cup sliced), zucchini (1 cup cooked), broccoli (1 cup steamed), cauliflower (1 cup steamed), green beans (1 cup steamed).
Veg.Dont: Pungent, hot, or excessively sour vegetables: onions, garlic, chilies, radishes, potatoes (in moderation due to starch).

Spices.Do: Cooling spices: coriander (1 tsp ground), cumin (1/2 tsp ground), fennel (1/2 tsp ground), cardamom (1/4 tsp ground).
Spices.Dont: Heating spices: red chili powder, ginger (in excess), black pepper (in excess), cloves, mustard seeds.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooling leafy greens: spinach (1 cup cooked), kale (1 cup cooked, steamed), Swiss chard (1 cup cooked).
Leafy veg.Dont: Bitter or very pungent leafy greens in large quantities.

Oil.Do: Coconut oil (1-2 tsp per meal), sunflower oil (1-2 tsp per meal) in moderation. Focus on cooling oils.
Oil.Dont: Sesame oil, mustard oil, ghee (in large amounts if it increases heat).

Fruits.Do: Sweet and cooling fruits: apples (1 medium), pears (1 medium), berries (1 cup), melon (1 cup), grapes (1 cup).
Fruits.Dont: Sour and acidic fruits: citrus fruits (in excess), unripe fruits, pineapple, tomatoes.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Soaked almonds (4-6 pieces), walnuts (2-3 pieces). Soak to reduce Pitta.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Cashews, peanuts, pistachios, and excessive amounts of any nuts due to their heating nature.

Milk product.Do: Full-fat yogurt (1/2 cup, diluted), milk (1 cup, lukewarm, with cardamom).
Milk product.Dont: Sour curd, buttermilk (if too sour), excessive cheese, ice-cold dairy.

Condiments.Do: Sweet chutneys (mint, coriander), a pinch of rock salt.
